articles.headline: Sam Bankman-Fried Makes His Last Stand
articles.snippet: Since the disgraced crypto mogul was convicted of fraud, his supporters have maneuvered to secure a lenient sentence, with his lawyers recommending he serve no longer than 6.5 years in prison.
articles.abstract: Since the disgraced crypto mogul was convicted of fraud, his supporters have maneuvered to secure a lenient sentence, with his lawyers recommending he serve no longer than 6.5 years in prison.
articles.lead_paragraph: Since Sam Bankman-Fried was convicted of fraud last year, he has hired a new lawyer known for courtroom showmanship. A group of sympathetic law professors has pushed for a reappraisal of his actions. And his parents have turned for help to former employees of FTX, the collapsed cryptocurrency exchange he founded.
articles.byline: By David Yaffe-Bellany and Matthew Goldstein

articles.headline: Back From War, Reserve Soldiers Set Their Sights on Israel’s Politics as Usual
articles.snippet: Inspired by the unity they experienced in the military, thousands of reservists returning from the front line in Gaza are organizing for political change.
articles.abstract: Inspired by the unity they experienced in the military, thousands of reservists returning from the front line in Gaza are organizing for political change.
articles.lead_paragraph: Gathered this month around a campfire on the edge of a forest in central Israel, the soldiers planned their next mission: saving their deeply divided country from itself.

articles.headline: Disney to Step Back From India in Mega-Deal with Reliance Industries
articles.snippet: Mukesh Ambani’s Reliance Industries will control what is left of Disney’s grasp at India’s burgeoning media market.
articles.abstract: Mukesh Ambani’s Reliance Industries will control what is left of Disney’s grasp at India’s burgeoning media market.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Walt Disney Company announced on Wednesday a joint venture with India’s biggest conglomerate, Reliance Industries, in an $8.5 billion deal that will create a media powerhouse in the world’s most populous nation and end Disney’s decades-long solo effort to gain a foothold in the market.
articles.byline: By Alex Travelli and Sameer Yasir

articles.headline: Streaming Prices Keep Going Up. Here’s How to Manage Subscriptions.
articles.snippet: Canceling is simple. The tough part is remembering to do it.
articles.abstract: Canceling is simple. The tough part is remembering to do it.
articles.lead_paragraph: The dream of streaming — watch what you want, whenever you want, for a sliver of the price of cable! — is coming to an end.
